asset:playlist.asset:title: How to Handle Rumors that a Valued Employee May Leave
asset:playlist.asset:description: Marcelo’s heard that Christine, an exemplary employee, plans to leave the company. He confronts her—including trying to make her feel guilty about leaving. She’s shocked by his aggressive approach. A professional coach describes a more effective response—starting with finding out if such rumors are even true.
asset:playlist.asset:biography:
Coach 

Lauren Mackler is an internationally renowned executive and life coach, bestselling author, and keynote speaker. Over the past 25 years she’s been a psychotherapist, corporate executive, leader of Arthur Andersen’s Human Capital consulting practice, and a leading authority in human behavior, leadership, and professional performance.

Lauren’s the author of the international bestseller “Solemate: Master the Art of Aloneness & Transform Your Life,” and contributor to “Speaking of Success” with Stephen Covey, Ken Blanchard, and Jack Canfield. Her work is frequently featured in the media, including CNN, FOX, the Wall Street Journal, the Huffington Post, the London Daily Mail, the Boston Globe, and the Boston Business Journal. Contact Lauren at http://www.laurenmackler.com.

Actors

Marcelo Illarmo is a member of ImprovBoston. He is also an associate litigation lawyer with Sullivan & Worcester LLP who has represented a variety of clients from small construction firms to Fortune 500 companies.

After performing with Liquid Fun’s inaugural cast at Boston University, Marcelo joined Face Off (formerly TheatreSports) before his senior year of college. In addition to performing with Face Off, he has performed in various shows, including a staging of his one-man show, “Tales of a Broken Heart.” His favorite memories of ImprovBoston include hosting the Sunday Night Jam with JR Strauss and performing an original musical he cowrote in college, “Jesus Christ Mega Star.”

Marcelo graduated from Boston University with a BA, magna cum laude. He attended the Boston University School of Law.

Christine Cuddy, who prefers to be called by her last name, is a seasoned actress. She grew up in the Boston area, where she trained in the performing arts. She also learned her trade at the Second City and Annoyance theaters in Chicago. She performs with the Mainstage cast and teaches improv at ImprovBoston. She writes and performs in OBV!, a two-woman show with Megan Goltermann, and has appeared in regional commercials. Christine can be heard on the ImprovBoston podcast with Will Luera and Harry Gordon. Her favorite festival experience is performing in the Improv Allstar Show with Rachel Dratch at the Women in Comedy Festival in Boston. 

Other ImprovBoston credits include “Cabin Pressure,” “The A-Team,” “The Real Housewives of the Magick Kingdom,” and “The Lodge,” a three-person show that plays to her biggest strength--being a townie. Christine has performed at improv festivals all over the United States, Ireland, and Spain.

Christine graduated from Framingham State University with a degree in communication arts with a focus in acting and directing.
